title: Please identify .jpg
content:
The “O” is the only really distinctive feature.  
Thank you in anticipation.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211732im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Tonic_4152.jpg)
  
This has been sketched in Coreldraw from a fascia.
 [‹ can any one recognise this font](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211732/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43403 "Go to previous forum topic") [Between Gotham and Matinee ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211732/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43405 "Go to next forum topic")
author: signart

comments.content:
Tom  
The “O” is the only real distinctive feature.  
This is a sketch from the fascia, in coreldraw

Looks odd. The O and C should be a little bigger. I like the N being kind of extended then the other letters.

Odd is good!

Cheers

Andre

(It looks handlettered and odd because the poster sketched it from something they saw.)

I think what you saw was [Dolmen](http://web.archive.org/web/20080708211732/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=dolmen&x=0&y=0&sample_text=TONIC).
